sec.title: Let Your Voice Be Heard: Vote for Your 2014 Leaders
sec.p: May 15 through June 17 is one of the most important periods on the AADE calendar. It’s the time when AADE members get to elect their volunteer leaders. Those leaders set the association’s strategic vision and ensure that it’s relevant and addresses the core needs of the profession.

The balloting will be completely paperless. All AADE members who are eligible to vote will receive an email link to the voting site. Just click on the link and you will be forwarded to the online ballot.
Candidate information is available on the online ballot. The following positions will be decided in the upcoming election:

list-item.p: Officers: President-elect, Treasurer
Board of Directors: 4 positions, each to fill a 3-year term
Member Affiliates Liaison to the Board: 1 position, to fill a 2-year term
Nominating Committee: 4 members will be elected, each to fill a 1-year term.

sec.p: Voting on AADE’s newest leaders is a great way that you can personally impact the future of AADE, so please take the time to vote.

sec.title: The AADE13 Exhibit Hall Is a Great Learning Opportunity
sec.p: Keeping up with the latest developments in diabetes treatment is harder than ever. Fortunately, the exhibit hall at AADE13 is the one place you can go to see all these developments firsthand.

Each year, your patients face a multitude of new products, medications, and foods that could help them manage their diabetes. At AADE13, you’ll be able to see, touch, and sample these products for yourself. Speak directly to company representatives so that you can get all the answers you need to decide if the products are right for your patients. You’ll come away from the exhibit hall with a full understanding of new and current options for your patients.
This year, AADE13’s mobile application will feature an interactive map of the exhibit hall that will make it easier than ever to locate the exhibitors you want to visit on the show floor.

Our exhibit hall features a full range of companies, from device makers, to pharmaceutical companies, to food producers, and many others. See an updated list of exhibitors on our Web site—www.diabeteseducator.org/annual. Don’t miss this great educational opportunity!

sec.title: Coming Soon—New and Revised AADE Publications
sec.p: AADE will soon be offering a revised review guide to help prepare you for the CDE exam as well as 2 new publications focusing on specialized aspects of diabetes management that also include continuing education.

p.italic: Diabetes Education Review Guide, 2nd ed, revised

list-item.p: This revised edition of the popular CDE exam review guide will include an additional online practice exam of 200 multiple-choice questions and answer rationales.
This publication will focus on the special needs and challenges in managing diabetes in senior adults with diabetes.

This new title will highlight the growing problem of prediabetes and metabolic syndrome, how clinicians should assess and treat, the complications associated with each, and how prediabetes and metabolic syndrome present in certain populations.

sec.p: Check your inboxes for more information on each of these much-needed publications or visit www.diabeteseducator.org.

sec.title: See What’s Available in the Diabetes Resource Connection
sec.p: The Diabetes Resource Connection offers you free, easy-to-access resources and information to help improve patient care. Once in the member center at www.diabeteseducator.org, click on “Diabetes Resource Connection” and log in with your AADE user ID and password.
Here you can quickly locate available products, order resources, and send them directly to your patients!
Access over 10 000 point of care resources, including

list-item.p: Product information
Patient education materials
Product samples, coupons, and vouchers
Patient assistance information.

sec.p: Click and get connected to all the resources, information, and services you want, when and where you want them, through a single access point from AADE.
